文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_024_chunk1
证据片段: The solute strengthening effect of oxygen in commercial-purity Zircaloy-2 was investigated over the temperature range 1023 to 1873 K, strain rate range 10^-4 to 10^-1 s^-1, and oxygen concentration range 1260 to 12360 ppm.

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_024_chunk1
证据片段: The strain rate sensitivities fell in the following ranges, depending on the phases present: 0.15 to 0.20, 0.27 to 0.32, and 0.22 to 0.25 for the α, β, and (α+β) materials, respectively.

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_024_chunk1
证据片段: The strain rate sensitivities fell in the following ranges, depending on the phases present: 0.15 to 0.20, 0.27 to 0.32, and 0.22 to 0.25 for the α, β, and (α+β) materials, respectively.

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_024_chunk1
证据片段: The strain rate sensitivities fell in the following ranges, depending on the phases present: 0.15 to 0.20, 0.27 to 0.32, and 0.22 to 0.25 for the α, β, and (α+β) materials, respectively.

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_024_chunk1
证据片段: The materials to be tested were received in the form of hot extruded and swaged rods of 13-mm diameter

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_024_chunk1
证据片段: Cylindrical specimens of 8 to 10 mm in diameter were prepared, with a height-to-diameter ratio of 1.5.

证据片段: In the $( \alpha + \beta )$ phase region, the flow curves were characterized by a large yield drop

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_024_chunk2
证据片段: Zircaloy-2 with 1260-ppm oxygen exhibited the maximum yield drop at $1 1 7 3 \mathrm { \bf K }$

证据片段: At low strain rates, for example, $1 0 ^ { - 4 } \ : s ^ { - 1 }$ , no yield drop was detected at any temperature in any of the alloys

证据片段: the activation energies for both the α and β-phases are stress-dependent, decreasing with stress

证据片段: The yield points were not observed at grain sizes greater than $3 0 \ \mu \mathrm { m }$ or at strain rates smaller than $1 0 ^ { - 3 } \thinspace \mathsf { s } ^ { - 1 }$

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_024_chunk6
证据片段: Subsequently we observed that the addition of oxygen enhanced the yield point phenomena in $\pmb { \alpha }$ -Zircaloy-2 at temperatures near 1000 K.

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_024_chunk6
证据片段: The as-received Zircaloy-2 did not exhibit a significant yield drop in the fully $\pmb { \alpha }$ -domain, that is, between the test temperatures of 1023 and $1 1 2 3 \ \mathbf { K }$ at strain rates up to $1 0 ^ { - 2 } \mathsf { s } ^ { - 1 }$

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_024_chunk6
证据片段: A small yield drop was, nevertheless, observed when the strain rate was increased to $\overline { { 1 0 ^ { - 1 } \ { \mathsf { s } } ^ { - 1 } } }$

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_024_chunk6
证据片段: the standard soaking time at each test temperature was limited to about $2 0 \mathrm { \ m i n }$

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_024_chunk6
证据片段: in our previous work3 on a 4180-ppm oxygen-Zircaloy-2 material, we noted that annealing times of over $\mathfrak { s o o m i n }$ at 1073 K produce significant yield drops, even at strain rates as low as $1 0 ^ { - 2 } \thinspace \mathsf { s } ^ { - 1 }$

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_024_chunk6
证据片段: Similar behavior was observed' in unmodified Zircaloy-2 held for $2 0 0 0 \mathrm { { m i n } }$ at 1073 K.

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_024_chunk6
证据片段: Oxidation rate data for Zircaloy-4 in steam under isothermal conditions in the temperature range 1000 to $1 5 0 0 ^ { \circ } \mathbf { C }$ indicate that the kinetics of layer growth and oxygen consumption can be described by virtually ideal parabolic behavior.

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_024_chunk6
证据片段: We have measured the oxidation rate of pure, arc-melted, crystal-bar zirconium under similar conditions and have found differences in the reaction characteristics compared with Zircaloy-4.

文献ID: STP754-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_5th Volume_024_chunk6
证据片段: At temperatures from 1098 to $1 4 1 6 ^ { \circ } C$ , while parabolic kinetics are still observed, the growth rates for both phases are measurably different.
